intro: Tithymalus gulestanicus, commonly known as the Golestan tithymale, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Iran. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a peppery or spicy scent, while its flowers are usually white or pale yellow. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
